segment.documentation: BGM, A segment to indicate the beginning of a message and to transmit identifying number and the further specification of the message type (in data element 1001: Document/message name, coded), such as Container release order.
FTX, A segment to specify free form or processable supplementary information, such as: - special instructions
RFF, A segment to express a reference which applies to the entire message, such as: - release order reference number - container announcement reference number

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 1: A group of segments to identify vessel and voyage details relevant to the instruction.

segment.documentation: TDT, A segment to indicate the main carriage stage of the transport, such as carrier/liner service; also inland transport details can be specified.
RFF, A segment to provide a reference for the liner service, such as: - conference - marketing organization - syndicate - vessel sharing agreement
LOC, A segment to indicate a place/port corresponding to the transport stage, such as final place/port of discharge or port of loading.
DTM, A segment to indicate the arrival date and time relating to the main carriage.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 2: A group of segments to identify a party and related contacts.

segment.documentation: NAD, A segment to identify the party's name and address, and function, such as: - message recipient - message sender - carrier or agent - ordering customer - ordering customer agent
CTA, A segment to identify a person or department for contact purposes, such as: - information contact
RFF, A segment to identify a reference used by a party or at an address, such as: - reference at place of collection
DTM, A segment to indicate a date and time relating to the party.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 3: A group of segments to identify details relating to the cargo in a container, together with information on handling requirements.

segment.documentation: GID, A segment to identify a goods item. A goods item can be identified by a goods item number.
HAN, A segment to specify handling instructions for the goods item, such as: - hazardous cargo - off-dimensions
FTX, A segment to describe the goods item.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 4: A group of segments to describe the address, reference and date/time for the stuffing or the stripping of the goods item in the containers.

segment.documentation: NAD, A segment to identify an address relating to the goods item, such as: - place of positioning - Customs clearance place
DTM, A segment to indicate a date and time when the container is to be positioned, such as: - requested equipment positioning date/time - ultimate equipment positioning date/time
RFF, A segment to identify a reference used by a party or at an address.
MEA, A segment to specify measurements, other than dimensions, applicable to a goods item, such as: - gross weight
PCI, A segment to specify marks and numbers for the goods item.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 5: A group of segments to specify the distribution of a goods item among the containers.

segment.documentation: SGP, A segment to identify a container in which goods are transported.
MEA, A segment to specify the gross weight of that portion of the goods item in the container.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 6: A group of segments to specify dangerous goods details related to the goods item. One goods item may be in different dangerous goods classes.

segment.documentation: DGS, A segment to indicate the dangerous goods regulations for the corresponding mode of transport, class of dangerous goods, additional dangerous goods code, UN-number and shipment flash point.
FTX, A segment to specify supplementary details related to the dangerous goods, such as: - dangerous goods technical name - dangerous goods additional information
MEA, A segment to specify measurements of the dangerous goods, such as: - net net weight

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 7: SG9 A group of segments to specify details relating to the containers to be released.

segment.documentation: EQD, A segment to specify a container, container size and type, and full/empty indication.
RFF, A segment to specify a reference number relevant to the container, such as: - release number - reference at the place of collection
TSR, A segment to specify special instructions and/or services regarding the container, such as seals to be checked, damage to be inspected.
MEA, A segment to specify measurement, other than dimensions, associated with the container, such as: - tare weight - gross weight
DIM, A segment to specify off-standard dimensions applicable to the container.
TMP, A segment to specify the transport temperature setting of a container.
RNG, A segment to specify the transport temperature range setting of the container.
SEL, A segment to identify seal and seal issuer associated with the container, such as shipper, consolidator, carrier (sea) and Customs.
FTX, A segment to specify processable supplementary information associated with the container, such as: - loading instructions (seagoing vessel) - special instructions (related to inland transport)
EQA, A segment to specify details of any equipment attached to the container, such as: - clip-on unit number

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 8: A group of segments to specify details of the inland transport relevant to the collection of the container.

segment.documentation: TDT, A segment to specify details of the inland transport associated with the collection of the container.
LOC, A segment to specify a place/port associated with the inland transport, such as: - place of departure - place of arrival
DTM, A segment to specify a date/time relating to the inland transport, such as arrival or departure date/time.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 9: A group of segments to identify different parties/places relevant to the collection of the container.

segment.documentation: NAD, A segment to specify a party or other address relevant to the release of the container: - consignee - consignee's agent - place of collection
DTM, A segment to indicate a date and time relating to the party.
CTA, A segment to identify a person or department for the specified party.
COM, A segment to identify the communication number on the EDI-network (e.g. mailbox number) to whom a copy of the Container gate-in/gate-out report message should be sent.
CNT, A segment to specify the number of containers in the message, explicitly given by the sender.
